Detailed Description

A spatial path with no time or angle information.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ BezierPath()

planning::BezierPath::BezierPath ( const std::vector< rj_geometry::Point > &  points,
rj_geometry::Point  vi,
rj_geometry::Point  vf,
MotionConstraints  motion_constraints 
)

Construct a bezier path for a curve with a given velocity, going through the specified points and with specified velocity at endpoints.

Parameters
pointsThe points through which the final curve must pass. These will be used as the endpoints for consecutive Bezier segments. In total there will be points.size() - 1 curves. This must not be empty.
viThe initial velocity, used as a tangent for the first curve.
vfThe final velocity, used as a tangent for the last curve.
motion_constraintsLinear constraints for motion. These are used to approximate the time between control points, which is later used to match up tangent vectors (approximately) with velocities.

Member Function Documentation

◆ evaluate()

void planning::BezierPath::evaluate ( double  s,
rj_geometry::Point *  position = nullptr,
rj_geometry::Point *  tangent = nullptr,
double *  curvature = nullptr 
) const

Evaluate the path at a particular instant drawn from [0, 1]. Calculates only those values requested (by passing in a non-null pointer).

Parameters
sThe index to sample along, in the range of [0, 1].
positionOutput parameter for the position at s, if non-null.
tangentOutput parameter for the tangent vector at s, if non-null.
curvatureOutput parameter for the curvature at s, if non-null.
